+serjthereturn From HRW
"Human Rights Watch's letter to D'Alema recounted that between 1992 and 
1995, the height of the conflict, Ocalan's PKK is believed to have been 
responsible for at least 768 extrajudicial executions, mostly of civil 
servants and teachers, political opponents, off-duty police officers and 
soldiers, and those deemed by the PKK to be "state supporters." In 
addition, the PKK committed numerous large-scale massacres of civilians, 
usually against villagers or villages that were believed to be connected 
with the state civil defense "village guard system." In twenty-five such 
massacres committed between 1992 and 1995, 360 people were killed, 
including thirty-nine women and seventy-six children. These actions were 
not committed by rogue units or commanders, but were PKK official policy." 

(This is only a FRACTION of what they did back then, not to mention they 
have done far worse before and since) 

The TAK is the PKK .. they are the exact same group. The PKK will often 
create such umbrella groups to carry out attacks etc without damaging their 
own image .. which is very good abroad atm because lots and lots of idiots 
believe in the fairy tale that the PKK is fighting ISIS 

Kurds are fighting ISIS yes .. but it's not the PKK, it's groups like the 
Peshmerge who are actually closely allied with Turkey are trained by 
Turkey, supported, armed etc by Turkey. (Peshmerge are the forces of the 
Kurdish regional government of Iraq)

you are correct. it's important to note the TAK did Ankara not PKK, 
although even TAK admitted civilians not the target, soldiers were and they 
messed up, with tragic consequences.

+Vincent Hitchin 1. The BBC is vehemently anti Turkish. As is most of the 
western press. Right wing, Left wing, Center,  it really doesn't matter all 
that much.  We are still the "scary" Turks at the gate of Europe. 

2. No one here is defending retard Erdogan being a ticklish little 12 year 
old queen and crying over every negative comment someone makes about it. 
It's pathetic and even his supporters are embarrassed by it. 

*THAT SAID* .. Erdogan doesn't want to negotiate? What the fuck are you on 
about? Erdogan has been "negotiating" for FIFTEEN YEARS .. the PKK promised 
to retreat out of Turkey, disarm etc. And did NONE of that. 

In fact, Erdogans "negotiations" are the reason why we are in this mess 
right now.*without Erdogan PKK wouldn't exist today* 

Erdogan with his "peace process" allowed them to make propaganda, stockpile 
weapons, recruit kids and even kidnap kids and commit a terrorist act now 
and then for 15 fucking years. PKK terrorists were given amnesty and were 
greeted by their supporters as heroes. They turned in to city terrorists, 
recruited youth, forced the local people to pay "tax"  to help for their 
"revolution", spread propaganda etc etc. 

15 FUCKING YEARS ... 

The problem isn't that we aren't negotiating .. the problem is that we 
TRIED, for 15 years no less even though everyone with half a brain knew the 
PKK was never gonna lay down their arms and seek a peaceful solution in 
parliament.. 

*WHEN THEY GOT THE CHANCE* with the HDP who got in to parliament even 
getting the support from the Turkish far left in good faith, hoping for 
peace and a Turkey for all. Instead the party was sabotaged by the PKK who 
started a bloody terror campaign, worried the party was gaining too much 
power and they (PKK) were becoming irrelevant. The terror and HDP's 
inability to condemn the terror + them being PKK puppets made their support 
plummet. IF there were elections today they wouldn't make it in to 
parliament. All because of the PKK.. who supposedly is working for Kurdish 
rights. See the HDP condemns terror, and their base turns on them (ultra 
nationalist/racist Kurds/PKK sympathisers) .. They don't .. and they lose 
all the votes they got by "ACTING"  like they are some all inclusive 
leftist party "party of Turkey"  as they called them selves LOL (yeah sure) 
...  radical right in the east, and radical left in the west .. how 
convenient. 

No one ever willingly let a part of their country secede .. no such thing 
happened in Europe. Only real example would be the UK/Ireland, which took 
decades of terror and in the end a revolution. 


Turkey has been Turkish for a THOUSAND years now. It was never Kurdish. If 
every minority, religious group, community etc decided to become their own 
country we'd have a billion new countries in the UN tomorrow. 

Besides that, *IF ... IF* the Kurds really wanted to secede .. they just 
had the PERFECT opportunity.. 

Support for the PKK among Kurds was at an ALL TIME HIGH. Never in the 
history of PKK has it been so high (thanks AKP .. thanks Erdogan, thanks 
"negotiations and peaceprocess") 

The PKK decided to descend to the cities and take the fight from the 
mountains to the cities. 

The PKK hoped that the people would stand with them, be their meat shield, 
support them, shield them, feed them and welcome them as heroes. *That a 
massive Kurdish uprising would happen, a revolution* something even an army 
cannot stop ... They thought they would have pictures of dead Kurdish 
civilians plastered all over the western Media with the Turkish army as the 
culprits etc... 

*NOW ... this is actually a BRILLIANT plan... if the people really wanted a 
revolution .. if the people really did support you* 

But it did not happen, instead. The Kurds turned on the PKK, who came out 
of nowhere. Blocked all the street with baricades, forced them from their 
homes to create sniper positions, made holes in walls/tunnels to hide and 
quickly move from building to building etc. Abused them, took their 
belongings, claimed their homes "for the revolution". Stopped their kids 
from going to school, by not plastering the streets and buildings all over 
with EID's but also by simply blowing up the schools etc. 

The Kurdish civilians all packed their stuff and left their homes migrating 
westwards under protection of the Turkish army. While the PKK was 
threatening and attacking them for being traitors. 

Now the PKK is getting their asses handed to them. And all of a sudden they 
want to negotiate again etc. 

How about, go fuck your self ...  negotiations are not an option anymore

+Enes Yasin Öz "But why that hate on Turkish people themselves? Just 
because they're Muslim?" No, I don't see why that would be an issue. If it 
was about that, surely we would hate both the Turks and the Kurd's. You 
can't accuse us (least of all the BBC for God's sake!) of bigotry against 
Turkish people or Muslims.

What confuses a lot of people is Erdoğan's anti-free speech edicts and why 
he won't negotiate with the YPG or the PKK. Why is separation, or at least 
the opportunity to get it with a referendum such an outrageous thing to ask 
for?

Many European countries have given smaller subsets of their population a 
vote on secession. Spain may give a referendum to Catalonia on whether it 
wants to secede, Britain gave Scotland, which makes up a third of the 
territory of Britain, a referendum on secession.

It just seems to me that Turkey, or rather its government, does not want 
the Kurd's to have the opportunity to secede at all. If that's not the case 
then give them a referendum (although at this point they would most likely 
vote for separation).
